alert.note: Alert for Lake (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 05 at 1:50AM CDT until April 11 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Milwaukee/Sullivan WI has issued a Flood Watch for the following river in Illinois...Wisconsin... Fox River Lower Near New Munster affecting Lake and Kenosha Counties. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Fox River Lower near New Munster. * WHEN...From early this morning to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.1 feet, Water is up to the first floor levels of some homes in the Town of Wheatland and Village of Salem Lakes area along Riverside Drive and Shorewood Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late this evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River forecasts are available for some but not all river gaging locations. The 7 day river forecast takes into account past precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and predicted precipitation for the basin. Precipitation is for the next 24 hours in the future from April through September and for 48 hours in the future from October through March. (Stages in ft.) Bank- Latest Forecast stages - Flood full observed ...for 1 am... Location stage stage stage/time Thu Fri Sat Sun New Munster 11.0 10.0 9.73 1 am 4/05 11.2 12.0 12.0 11.7 - Highest 24 hour change - observed in river stage - stage in (ft.) up to Highest stage - the last latest observed forecast in - 7 days stage next 7 days New Munster 9.93 10 am 4/02 0.17 12.00 1 am 4/08 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1000 AM CDT.
